texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I'm a big fan of the  pyenv  project because it makes installing multiple python versions a simple process. However, I kept stumbling into a segmentation fault whenever I tried to build documentation with sphinx in Python 2.7.11:
texts.text: I'm a big fan of the  pyenv  project because it makes installing multiple python versions a simple process. However, I kept stumbling into a segmentation fault whenever I tried to build documentation with sphinx in Python 2.7.11:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I tried a few different versions of sphinx, but the segmentation fault persisted. I did a quick reinstallation of Python 2.7.11 in the hopes that a system update of gcc/glibc was causing the problem:
texts.text: I tried a few different versions of sphinx, but the segmentation fault persisted. I did a quick reinstallation of Python 2.7.11 in the hopes that a system update of gcc/glibc was causing the problem:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The same segmentation fault showed up again. After a ton of Google searching, I found that the
texts.text: The same segmentation fault showed up again. After a ton of Google searching, I found that the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: option allows pyenv to use shared Python libraries at compile time:
texts.text: option allows pyenv to use shared Python libraries at compile time:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That worked! I'm now able to run sphinx without segmentation faults.
texts.text: That worked! I'm now able to run sphinx without segmentation faults.
